intro: Telis ornithopodioides, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a dense cluster, and bloom during the summer months. Telis ornithopodioides is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
